Eight factors of a fine royal thoroughbr: Well born on both the mother’s and the father’s sides
Bred in the region fine thoroughbreds come from
Eats carefully, without making a mess
Disgusted by sitting or lying down in excrement or urine
Sweet-natured and pleasant to live with, and doesn’t upset the other horses
Openly shows his tricks, bluffs, ruses, and feints to his trainer
Carries his load, determining to carry his load even if other horses don't
Always walks in a straight path and stays strong even until death
Eight qualities of a mendicant [an8.13:2: Ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places
Disgusted with bad conduct by way of body, speech, or mind, and by attainment of the many kinds of unskillful things
Sweet-natured and pleasant to live with, and doesn’t upset the other mendicants
Openly shows their tricks, bluffs, ruses, and feints to their sensible spiritual companions
Does their training, determining to do it even if other mendicants don't
Always walks in a straight path, which is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion
Energetic and determined to achieve what is possible by human strength, energy, and vigor.
